sen.j: 中村 弘毅（なかむら こうき/ひろたけ、天保9年（1838年）11月_(旧暦)－明治20年（1887年）7月3日）は、幕末の土佐藩藩士。
sen.e: Koki NAKAMURA (his name can also be called Hirotake) (November, 1838 - July 3, 1887) was a feudal retainer of Tosa Province in the end of Edo period.
Koki NAKAMURA (his name can also be called Hirotake) (November, 1838 - July 3, 1887) was a feudal retainer of Tosa Province in the end of Edo period.
Koki NAKAMURA (his name can also be called Hirotake) (November, 1838 - July 3, 1887) was a feudal retainer of Tosa Province in the end of Edo period.

sen.j: 明治政府において太政官内閣書記官長・元老院議官などを歴任した。
sen.e: He held various posts such as Chief Cabinet Secretary of Daijokan (Grand Council of State) and Genroin gikan (councilor of Chamber of Elders) in the Meiji government.
He held various posts such as Chief Cabinet Secretary of Daijokan (Grand Council of State) and Genroin gikan (councilor of Chamber of Elders) in the Meiji government.
He held various posts such as Chief Cabinet Secretary of Daijokan (Grand Council of State) and Genroin gikan (councilor of Chamber of Elders) in the Meiji government.

sen.j: 通称は小文次・幹之助・楨助。
sen.e: He was commonly called Komonji (小文次), Mikinosuke (幹之助) or Teisuke (楨助).
sen.cmt: 「小文次」「幹之助」「楨助」の読み不明
sen.e: He was commonly called Komonji (小文次), Mikinosuke (幹之助) or Teisuke (楨助).
He was commonly called Komonji (小文次), Mikinosuke (幹之助) or Teisuke (楨助).

sen.j: 文久2年（1862年）に藩校致道館の設立と同時に助教となり、同年中に教授に昇進。
sen.e: He became an assistant professor at a domain school, Chido-kan (Confucian school) as soon as it was established in 1862, and then was promoted to a professor during the year.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: He became an assistant professor at a domain school, Chido-kan (Confucian school) as soon as it was established in 1862, and then was promoted to a professor during the year.
He became an assistant professor at a domain school, Chido-kan (Confucian school) as soon as it was established in 1862, and then was promoted to a professor during the year.

sen.j: 以後小監察・郡奉行・京都留守居役などを歴任する。
sen.e: Since then, he held various posts such as a junior inspector, a county magistrate and Kyoto rusuiyaku (a person representing the master during his absence).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処「監察」は直訳です
sen.e: Since then, he held various posts such as a junior inspector, a county magistrate and Kyoto rusuiyaku (a person representing the master during his absence).
Since then, he held various posts such as a junior inspector, a county magistrate and Kyoto rusuiyaku (a person representing the master during his absence).

sen.j: 明治元年（1868年）に新政府に召されて刑法官権判事に就任した。
sen.e: Being called by the new government in 1868, he became an assistant judicial officer in a court.
sen.cmt: 刑法官：明治政府成立時の最高司法機関。<http://www.weblio.jp/content/%E5%88%91%E6%B3%95%E5%AE%98>を参考に英訳
sen.e: Being called by the new government in 1868, he became an assistant judicial officer in a court.
Being called by the new government in 1868, he became an assistant judicial officer in a court.

sen.j: 民部大丞・宮内大丞などを歴任するが、後に免官・位記剥奪処分を受ける。
sen.e: He held various posts such as Minbu taijo (Senior Secretary of the Ministry of Popular Affairs) and Kunai taijo (Senior Secretary of Imperial Household Ministry), but he was later dismissed from his post and forfeited Iki (court rank diploma) for punishment.

He held various posts such as Minbu taijo (Senior Secretary of the Ministry of Popular Affairs) and Kunai taijo (Senior Secretary of Imperial Household Ministry), but he was later dismissed from his post and forfeited Iki (court rank diploma) for punishment.

He held various posts such as Minbu taijo (Senior Secretary of the Ministry of Popular Affairs) and Kunai taijo (Senior Secretary of Imperial Household Ministry), but he was later dismissed from his post and forfeited Iki (court rank diploma) for punishment.

sen.j: 後に右大臣岩倉具視の取り成しによって復官し、明治10年（1877年）に太政官大書記官、2年後に初代内閣書記官長となる。
sen.e: He later came back to the former post through the mediation of Tomomi IWAKURA, Udaijin (Minister of the Right) and then he became a grand secretary of Daijokan (Grand Council of State) in 1877 and the first Chief Secretary of the Cabinet two years later.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処大書記官<http://muse.jhu.edu/journals/monumenta_nipponica/v061/61.3mcdermott.pdf>
sen.e: He later came back to the former post through the mediation of Tomomi IWAKURA, Udaijin (Minister of the Right) and then he became a grand secretary of Daijokan (Grand Council of State) in 1877 and the first Chief Secretary of the Cabinet two years later.

He later came back to the former post through the mediation of Tomomi IWAKURA, Udaijin (Minister of the Right) and then he became a grand secretary of Daijokan (Grand Council of State) in 1877 and the first Chief Secretary of the Cabinet two years later.

sen.j: （ただし、この時代の内閣は今日の内閣制度とは違い太政官内の非公式合議体であった。）
sen.e: (In those days, however, the cabinet was different from the present system, and was a closed collegiate body within Daijokan.)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: (In those days, however, the cabinet was different from the present system, and was a closed collegiate body within Daijokan.)
(In those days, however, the cabinet was different from the present system, and was a closed collegiate body within Daijokan.)

sen.j: 明治13年（1880年）に元老院議官に任ぜられ従四位に叙せられる。
sen.e: In 1880, he was appointed to Genroin gikan (councilor of Chamber of Elders) and received Jushii (Junior Fourth Rank).
In 1880, he was appointed to Genroin gikan (councilor of Chamber of Elders) and received Jushii (Junior Fourth Rank).
In 1880, he was appointed to Genroin gikan (councilor of Chamber of Elders) and received Jushii (Junior Fourth Rank).

sen.j: 明治17年（1884年）に工部少輔に転じるが間もなく元老院議官に復帰した。
sen.e: He re-appointed to Kobu no shoyu (Junior Assistant Minister of Industry) in 1884, but came back to Genro gikan soon.
He re-appointed to Kobu no shoyu (Junior Assistant Minister of Industry) in 1884, but came back to Genro gikan soon.
He re-appointed to Kobu no shoyu (Junior Assistant Minister of Industry) in 1884, but came back to Genro gikan soon.

sen.j: 政治的には佐々木高行や谷干城、土方久元と同じ天皇親政・保守強硬派（中正派）に属していた。
sen.e: Politically, he belonged to a hard-line conservative emphasizing direct imperial rule (Chuseiha [neutral group]), the same group as Takayuki SASAKI, Tateki TANI, and Hisamoto HIJIKATA.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Politically, he belonged to a hard-line conservative emphasizing direct imperial rule (Chuseiha [neutral group]), the same group as Takayuki SASAKI, Tateki TANI, and Hisamoto HIJIKATA.
Politically, he belonged to a hard-line conservative emphasizing direct imperial rule (Chuseiha [neutral group]), the same group as Takayuki SASAKI, Tateki TANI, and Hisamoto HIJIKATA.

sen.j: が、藩閥主導の政治を変えるためには土佐の保守派と自由民権派が手を携えるべきであると考えて両者の提携に尽力したが、志半ばで病死した。
sen.e: However, he thought that conservatives in Tosa and advocates of Freedom and Popular Rights needed to joined together to change politics led by domain cliques and made efforts for alliance between the both parties, but he died of illness without fulfilling his life ambition.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, he thought that conservatives in Tosa and advocates of Freedom and Popular Rights needed to joined together to change politics led by domain cliques and made efforts for alliance between the both parties, but he died of illness without fulfilling his life ambition.

However, he thought that conservatives in Tosa and advocates of Freedom and Popular Rights needed to joined together to change politics led by domain cliques and made efforts for alliance between the both parties, but he died of illness without fulfilling his life ambition.
